summary: john peacock has named his england squad for next month's european under-17 championship in bulgaria . the young lions are the defending champions, having beaten holland on penalties in the final last year . they have been placed in group d alongside holland, italy and the republic of ireland this time around and will open their campaign against italy on may 7 .

aspect: 1. England coach John Peacock has named a 21-player squad for the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria.
2. The Young Lions are defending champions, having beaten Holland on penalties in the final last year.
3. They progressed to this edition with a 100% record in qualifying and are placed in Group D.
4. Their first match is against Italy in Burgas on May 7.
5. Talented young players from Premier League clubs, including Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea, are in the squad.
6. Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi have been called up for the first time.
7. Liverpool duo Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold have earned a recall after missing the Elite Round of qualifiers last month.
8. Their other matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.
explain:
To systematically describe or detail the key points or essence of a concept to someone in a clear and understandable manner.

In this case, the core idea of the aspect is to provide an overview of the England Under-17 squad named by coach John Peacock for the upcoming UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria.

To elaborate on the squad, it is important to note that England are the defending champions, having won the tournament last year, and they will be facing stiff competition from other group D teams, including the Netherlands and Republic of Ireland. Additionally, Italy is also part of their group, making the competition even more challenging.

In regards to the given aspect, it is important to note that the Young Lions, representing England, are defending champions of the European Under-17 Championship. The team won the championship last year by defeating a strong Dutch side in a gripping final that went to penalties. This feat was accomplished amidst strong competition, making their victory even more significant. This information adds context to the other aspects presented in the summary and emphasizes the team's potential to retain their title. As the defending champions, the Young Lions will undoubtedly be one of the teams to watch in this year's tournament, which is set to take place in Bulgaria next month.

The core idea of the given aspect is that England's national under-17 football team has qualified for the European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria with an unbeaten record, and they have been placed in Group D. This means that they have successfully navigated through their qualifying rounds, securing their place in the tournament with a perfect record. Their performance in qualifying indicates that they are likely to be a strong contender in the upcoming edition of the championship.

To explain the core idea of the given aspect, it is necessary to delve into the context of the information provided. The main idea highlighted is that England's first match of the European Under-17 Championship will be against Italy in Burgas on May 7.

In summary, here's the core idea:
The first match of England's European Under-17 Championship campaign will take place against Italy in Burgas on May 7.

To provide a clear and concise understanding of a key concept or main point, highlighting the main details or features.

In the given aspect, the core idea is that several talented young players from Premier League clubs, including Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea, have been named in the England Under-17 squad for the upcoming European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. These players bring with them valuable experience from their respective clubs, which could help the English team perform well in the tournament.

To make the central or essential point, concept, or meaning of something clear and understandable.

In this context, the core idea of the given aspect is that two young English players, Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi, have been selected for the England Under-17 squad for the first time. They are among the 20 players chosen by John Peacock for the European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria next month, where England will defend their title as defending champions.

To clarify the main concept or essential meaning of something.

In the given aspect, the core idea is that Liverpool duo Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold have been recalled to the England Under-17 squad after missing the Elite Round of qualifiers last month. This suggests that they were initially part of the squad for the Elite Round but couldn't participate due to some reason, and now they have been selected again for the upcoming European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. It's worth mentioning that these players have performed well in the past, as Liverpool players often showcase exceptional talent and skill. Their inclusion in the squad will undoubtedly strengthen England's chances of defending their title, as they bring with them valuable experience and football prowess.
